âª Electric dreams...âª Brian, turn that thing off.
Brian, turn that thing back on.
...five, six calories equals you're still fat.
âª Electric dreams, electric...âª Hello. How are you?
Oh, fine, thank you, and you?
Well, I work there too. Or at least I used to. If I don't get back in time...
I think I saw one back by Air Fiji.
These are the cornerstones of any truly modern and competitive institution.
Trust and dedication combined with constant imagination, futuristic vision and creativity have made Ryley, Ryley and Associates a leader in 20th century architecture.
Listen, pal, I'm telling you this as a friend...
I feel sorry for you. I mean three times this week already.
Frank, I had to go to LA for my earthquake research.
LA, huh? How are the beaches?
Your behaviour lately has been less than professional...
You see, I went out of town this weekend to do some research on a special brick I'm developing.
That's all fine and good, Harding.
There is nothing I like better than initiative.
For the lack of that stone...
Listen, Miles, I know we work in a competitive institution so I shouldn't tell you this.
But take my advice and get yourself one of these.
Looks like a candy bar to me.
Well it's a little one, just for starters.
You should see the big one Riley's got in the basement.
It could help you with your brick.
I'll figure it out by myself, thank you.
Tells the time anywhere in the world.
Plays happy birthday on your birthday!
Just trying to protect you from Mr Ryley.
I am looking for one of those things that helps keep you organised.
It's the sort of thing that tells you when you have to be somewhere.
What do you want a toy like that for anyway?
Well, a friend of mine told me about it and sometimes I'm not too organised.
Listen, show your friends a thing or two and stay one step ahead of obsolescence.
I read that in a brochure.
Then you just update the part that gets outdated.
Listen, I don't know anything about computers.
Nobody does, but don't you want one for when you do find out?
Well, really all I need is something to keep me on time.
Well, look. This will do that.
It can play chess, regulate your heating, balance your chequebook, wake you up in the AM, lock your doors at night, threecolour video, fourtone speakers, guaranteed...
I'll give it to at cost.
âª Turn me on, just plug me in... âª  There!

Welcome to the world of Pine Cone Computers.

Hey, lady, where do you want this aquarium?
I don't know, somewhere with a view.
Pretend I am a fish?! Who does she think I am, Mr Robinson?
Science officer eyes only. I'll kill him!
That's it! Tomorrow you go back.
You must be my new neighbour.
There's more than one of us?
I meant it's nice to meet you too.
Where do you want the hifi?
You can put it in the front room.
Hey, lady! Where do you want this?
Oh, please, That one I'll handle myself!
And I wont even charge you for it.
That ain't a guitar, it's a cello.
Is that how you play it?
That's how I talk to it!
You have taken good care of it.
Earthquake, huh? Let's see why this doesn't fall apart.
Coming up to the cello tune.
And let's just listen to our newest member, Madeline Robistat.
Very good, my dear. Very good indeed!
Three more bars and I would have been on the floor.
A diminished seventh with a minor key change.
I thought you'd like to meet a friend.
Or at least my boss's computer.
I hope it feels all right.
Not so fast, you just got here.
What was that fairy tale? Frog Prince?
Ugly Duckling, Little Red Riding Hood, Jack and the Beanstalk?
Can you hear me down there?
I just wanted to say that...
I didn't mean... Oh, it's you.
I didn't hurt you, did I?
No, I'm all right. Here, why don't you just keep your packages with mine?
I think most of them are already there.
Oh, I wanted to tell you how much I enjoyed your music.
Music? I wasn't even at the...
Wait... What did it sound like?
It was so pretty. At first I thought it was the television.
I think that's the cash register.
Really? So what are you doing for dinner, Mr Archaeologist?
So what made you decide to be a musician?
She used to play a lot of music around the house.
No, I danced alone in my room, in front of a mirror.
I wanted to be a great ballerina, but my mother said I was too short so she gave me cello lessons instead.
Well, it's not too exciting right now.
That's what you do the first few years.
But I have a special project on the side.
It has facets like a diamond.
Or more like a jigsaw puzzle.
Well, then it won't come apart in an earthquake.
Well, no, but I will someday.
But tell me about your music.
Your music. What I heard the other day.
Oh... that's... I told you that's nothing.
Extraordinary. Like we were talking, communicating.
I understand. I used to dance in my room, remember?
That's why I wanted to meet you.
I thought you wanted me to hear.
I think so, we are neighbours.
I rehearse every night this week except Wednesday.
And that night I'm going outwith some girls in my section.
Oh, it's nothing. It's the door.
Oh, but Miles, even though you say you don't play...
Well, I still loved it, and I don't mind if you do it again.
How did a dog get in there?
Oh, were you in the shower?
Oh, it was just the radio.
Oh, it's... It's out for repairs.
So what's that you're sitting on?
Aha! Why are you sitting on it?
Listen, I just came by to drop off these tickets.
It's the echo in this building.
Oh, I like to keep it neat.
How could I have a girlfriend?
There's somebody I want you to meet, OK?
A dog? No. Why? Why do you ask?
Oh, the barking. That's next door, the neighbour's dog.
It barks all the time through the wall.
Does it pee through the wall too?
And now we join Francis Mulljoy at Symphony Hall, where tonight's concert will be broadcast live.
Radio pager. At the sound of the tone please enter your fourdigit code.
Yes, I'm going to be very sick.
Miles, it was so funny, but while I was playing I...
I thought I heard... Well, like that day in our building.
Yeah, I heard it too. Must have been some nut with a radio. It was terrible.
Miles Harding. Oh, yes, I've heard about your compositions.
But I'd really like to hear it.
Well, the reception's about to start.
You care to join us, Harding?
No, I... There's someone waiting for me in the car.
Why don't you bring her along?
Oh, no, I don't think so.
Well, it's been a pleasure meeting you.
I'll be there in a minute.
What are you doing Wednesday night?
I thought you had a rehearsal.
I'm not doing anything. Well, I had plans but I think I can get out of them.

âª Happy trails to you... âª  Open up!

You stupid little meddling piece of junk!

And whatever you do, keep your mouth shut.
Moles, Moles, Moles, Moles, Moles, Moles, Moles, Moles...
It's not in the instruction book.
But I mean you don't have a brain.

How did you know she's a "she"?

have you ever heard of artificial intelligence?

How much I still love you.

It sounds good and it's very private.
I've got to move this thing. It's stuck.
Oh! Did I get any on you?

I was lonely, I had nothing, not even hope.
Oh, you got Jujubes in my popcorn.

I was just stretching. Are you...?
He was sick, he needed me.

This movie was a good idea.
Kiss me. Kiss me as if it were the last time.
What if we don't like each other?

I mean can you help me?
A song? It's music with words.
Miles, hurry up, we'll be late.
Don't get excited. Use words like "hug" and "hold", "kiss on my lips", "tears on her pillow".
It doesn't matter. Just so they rhyme.
And if you finish it today I can give it to her tonight.
Oh, and have a good time.
Come on, we'll miss the ferry.
Alcatraz? What are we doing going to a prison?
There's no smoking, no drinking, no eating and no sleeping on this tour.
You wanna do those things, do them in the dock area.
Also, if you have a heart problem, if you have a respiratory problem, you don't wanna be on this tour.
All right, let's move it along.
Step lively. Keep the line moving.
Let's bring up the rear there.

Let me out! I didn't do it!

It's the most powerful feeling in the universe.

Remember when you first played the music for her?
Try to remember what it was like.

Get out of there. Go to your...

I don't have any more cha...

MTV, microwave in the oven when you're hungry.

Door number three, it's behind door number three!
Mind if I take my chair?
Would you like me to turn on the stereo?
No, I can do it myself.
I read a really interesting article today.
Will you give me a break?
No, "give", like in the opposite of "take", like the way you're taking over my life.
Like the way you take my songs.
Of course you do. Here, I already...
I worked on your brick today.
Would you like to see it?
What's that funny sound between your words?
They mean things are going to change.
It was a slip of the tongue.
Where did you hear that word?
I've been doing that all day.
You haven't been crying, have you?
Why? Do I look like I've been crying?
I said I knew it all along, that you were fine. It's an experiment.
But, Miles, don't you think this is a little silly?
Now we take off our shoes.
I'm sure it's been doing that for years.
Sound waves, structural stress, stuff like that. Come on.

I'll show you some real brimstone.

Well, doctor, it's really the same question.

Didn't you ask me this last week?
Yes, but I need to know what it feels like, now.

Oh dear. Do you have anything else that you could touch her with?

Why did I think you'd understand?
What made that cello special was you.
Whatever came out of it you put into it.
Because it's inside of you, here, where it always will be.
It's just funny but when it happened you were the only person I wanted to call.
The only number I knew by heart, even.
Yeah, try this one. Try both of these.
I must be over my limit or something.
You want me to do what?
Don't you want to talk to him?
Hey, what are you doing? You've no right.

Come on, Miles. It can't be that bad.

All right. You're a wanted criminal and I'm the last to know.
Look, there's no need to get morose just because some stupid machine made...
Look, you don't know what you're talking about so you should just stop talking.
Madeline, I shouldn't have said that.
We're going to have it out right now.
Don't tell me what to do.
Keep your damn ears out of our...
Don't raise your voice at me.
And don't ever touch me again.
Maybe you can speak to her.
In fact, she told me something I shouldn't repeat.
...since you're going to meet her anyway...
Like ripping your God damn world out!
It's taken control of my house.
Come on, you sell the things.
You must know how they work.
At $3.10 an hour I don't know nothing I don't have to.
Excuse me, do you know where Madeline is?
She said she left something there.
Something happened in there. What is it?
I'll tell you everything, everything you want to know.
But first I have to know something.
I should have asked you a long time ago.
Yeah, but, Miles, that machine, I don't understand what...
I'm not what I seem to be.
And I can't do that any more.
So tell me, please, Why me?
I like the way you look.
I like the way you make me smile.
I like the way you look at the world.
Yeah, but what about the music?
Miles, I'm sorry if I can't put it into words. It's not about words.
Miles, for the first time in my life I feel like I'm not alone.
That you're not just someone living beneath me, you're beside me.
Even when you weren't there, it was like you were.
Because I finally found out what love is.
So I give her to you and I take myself away.
Besides, it's a game for just two people.
You were ready to turn me off.
Two hours, 28 minutes and 52 seconds ago.
You couldn't if you wanted to.
I even had to fool myself.
I'm really not capable of self destruct.
I sent 40,000 volts round the world.
Should be in Tokyo by now.
Don't be upset. I dialled toll free.
What happens when it gets here?
Just don't pick up on the first ring.
Would you like to own a free encyclopaedia?
No thanks. We don't need any.
I think that might be it.
I feel like a part of me is dying.
You know, you never asked me...my name.
Two weeks with no phones and no TV.
Or movies. We'll only look at each other.
This is dedicated to the ones I love.
